paragraphs.name: 1c21
paragraphs.text: Killinger told ThinkProgress on Monday morning that the perpetrator had been sitting in the center and was “somebody who came around every so often.” Though this is not the first time he has displayed signs of anger, residents were still surprised when he suddenly became enraged and started yelling at a staff member, verbally and physically assaulting her. “He was literally pushing up against her,” Killinger said.

paragraphs.name: 92a8

paragraphs.text: Casa Ruby’s door may be shattered…
paragraphs.name: 77b9

virtuals.subtitle: Casa Ruby’s door may be shattered, but residents say its doors are still open.

content.subtitle: Casa Ruby’s door may be shattered, but residents say its doors are still open.

paragraphs.text: Something doesn’t add up. Was this “regular visitor” also transgender? A “regular visitor” at a trans shelter is probably trans and wouldn’t hang around trans people if they hated them. If the person was “cis” the writer would have definitely mentioned it. This doesn’t sound like a hate crime.
